questions.question_text: Which 2 statements explain why the Marketing Director should be appointed as the Executive for this project?

choices.A: She has been with the company for three years.
choices.D: She has authority to commit the marketing budget, from which the project will be funded.
choices.E: She requires more experience working with the engineering industry.
choices.B: She previously had a successful career in publicity.
choices.C: She is able to represent the business needs of MNO Manufacturing.

discussion.content:
C D
The other statements are either irrelevant or incorrect. The length of time she has been with the company (A) and her previous career in publicity (B) do not necessarily qualify her as the Executive for this project. The Engineering Manager might have more experience working with the engineering industry (E), but he is not part of the project team and does not have the authority to commit resources or monitor benefits.

choices.C: He restricts his visits to the engineering area.
choices.A: He started the company 25 years ago.
choices.E: He has an overall perspective of the business's strategic requirements.
choices.D: He has the authority to commit resources as required.
choices.B: He knows his job very well.

We all know that she can represent the marketing department , which is obvious but if you had to choose between A and D , where option D relates to funding , i think its a stronger choice between the 2, there C and D.

Statement C shows that the Marketing department, which she leads, will be crucial in delivering the project’s benefits. Statement D indicates that the project is funded from her department’s budget, which means she has a vested interest in ensuring the project’s success.

So C AND D
